intro: Chionohebe ciliolata, commonly known as the silver flax lily, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its soft, silvery-blue foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
